{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dentifrices, such as toothpaste, often contain abrasives to help remove plaque and stains from teeth. Calcium carbonate and silica are commonly used as abrasives in dentifrices. Sodium chloride, also known as salt, can also be used as a mild abrasive. Amylase, on the other hand, is an enzyme that breaks down starches into sugars and is not used as an abrasive.", "answer_choice": "D. Amylase"}
